comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Joel Bennett "Champ" Clark (1890-1954), senator from Missouri; here he's a young man, but in the succeeding years he would serve in WWI, go to law school, and serve two senate terms (1932-1944), and become a judge. He's buried at Arlington National Cemetery: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bennett_Champ_Clark

comment.author: 8623220@N02
comment._content: Thank you for this information! We will correct the name in the source data and reload the description.

comment.author: 11572312@N00
comment._content: He also was Speaker of the House and figured prominently in the election of 1912 (Wilson, Taft and TR, 3-way).  Several other photos of him on this LOC / Flickr, but he is older and more grim looking in those (try "Champ Clark" tag).

comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: He was the son of the Speaker Champ Clark. In April 1913 he was appointed House parliamentarian. He was just 23 years old (according to University Missourian., April 07, 1913, Image 1, col. 2, and Rock Island Argus., May 13, 1913, HOME EDITION, Page 4, col. 3 & 4, "CAPITAL COMMENT")
